summary: Brilliant ‘Captain Marvel’ theory connects the origin story to ‘Infinity War’ and ‘Endgame’
title: Brilliant ‘Captain Marvel’ theory connects the origin story to ‘Infinity War’ and ‘Endgame’
body:
Could this change everything??

We’ve got exactly one month to go until the premiere of Captain Marvel — it’s less than a month, considering that February is the shortest month of the year — but we still have no idea what happens in the film. We saw all the trailers and TV spots, and we did have several interesting leaks about the film. We think Jude Law is playing a villain and we already saw an official clip that ties Captain…

summary: Star-Lord couldn’t have prevented the ‘Infinity War’ deaths, even if Chris Pratt thinks so
title: Star-Lord couldn’t have prevented the ‘Infinity War’ deaths, even if Chris Pratt thinks so
body:
Ummm, not sure if we believe you Chris Pratt… LOL

Thanos may be the person who snapped his fingers, killing half of all living beings in the known universe in Avengers: Infinity War, but it’s two guys who get most of the blame for it. One is a Guardian of the Galaxy, and the other is an old-school Avenger. Yes, I’m talking about Star-Lord and Thor, respectively. Both of them squandered their chances to prevent Thanos from fulfilling his mission.…

View On WordPress

Avengers Endgame is without a doubt the biggest movie coming out this year (save for maybe the next Star Wars) and because of that, everyone wants to know how long it’ll be to complete the story. Directors the Russo Brothers…

summary: honestly, you know what i really want from endgame? i want tony to come back to earth and obviously steve and nat and bruce and...
body:
honestly, you know what i really want from endgame? i want tony to come back to earth and obviously steve and nat and bruce and rhodey and whoever else is there all ask what happened up there and he tells (probably mostly to rhodey) that peter is gone, and steve because he’s steve has the audacity to take the words “i am so sorry” in his mouth and you know what i want? i want him to fucking deck steve, fucking punch him in his stupid face so hard that his nose breaks because HOW DARE HE apologise NOW,,, steve who never apologised to tony for anything, not in ultron, not in civil war, who has shovelled all the burden of the earth onto tony’s shoulders through ignoring his knowledge, his insights, his fucking w i s d o m about what was about to happen, and now that tony faced all his demons up there in this desolate place, losing everything, guilt-ridden, already accepting death, after all that he returns to make sure this shit is fixed, to do everything in his power (like he has been doing since the very start, since he walked out of that hell hole in the desert) to fix the mistakes that have been made, and steve has the NERVE to try and apologise, tony just fucking loses it because if he had fucking listened, if any of them had fucking listened peter and the guardians and everyone would still be alive

and thor, precious thor, would take tony aside and truly, and heartfelt, and honestly tell tony how sorry he is for his loss, and he will be the only one who even remotely is allowed to do that because thor has lost everything and not through the snap. thor has lost his parents, his best friend, his brother, his people, he has no one left except the “””friends””” he made on earth, thor is the only one who can even remotely understand the pain and guilt tony feels

summary: Howard the duck has appeared in close proximity to the MCU guardians of the galaxy, partying or at least, in some way  drinking,...
body: Howard the duck has appeared in close proximity to the MCU guardians of the galaxy, partying or at least, in some way drinking, but did not appear in Infinity War. In the endgame trailer, Rocket is supposedly walking into a bar. In this essay I will prove Howard the Duck will play an essential role in the defeat of thanos–

summary: Oreo, the racoon who inspired Rocket from 'Guardians of the Galaxy', dies after short illness
title: Oreo, the racoon who inspired Rocket from 'Guardians of the Galaxy', dies after short illness
body:
Oreo, the racoon who was the model for Rocket in the Guardians of the Galaxy and Avengers movies, has died following a short illness.

He was 10.

The news was announced by his owners on Facebook.

“We have only the saddest news today,” they wrote. “Our hearts are broken as we have lost our best friend, our Guardian of our Galaxy Mr Oreo Raccoon.

 

“Oreo passed away in the early hours of this morning after a very short illness. Many thanks to our wonderful vets for their compassion and care.

“Oreo you made so many people’s lives happy. You have been an amazing ambassador for raccoons everywhere.”

Oreo was used in motion capture during the making of the movies, to accurately convey real racoon movements and mannerisms, and famously accompanied director James Gunn down the red carpet at the first movie’s premiere in London in 2014.

“You loved all people of all ages and other animals too and were never phased by anything be it a walk down the red carpet as Rocket Raccoon, a trip to a hospice to visit a sick child or anything else that came your way. You just enjoyed everything and it showed,” the statement went on.

You instinctively knew when to calm, when to be bouncy and we never worried that you would do the wrong thing because you never did.

You were perfect.

“Have fun up there over the Rainbow Bridge my darling. I hope, no I know they will all love you as much as we do. We will miss you so, so much. Fly high Oreo, our super hero.”

Rocket Racoon is voiced by Bradley Cooper in the Guardians of the Galaxy and Avengers movies.

He’ll next be seen in Avengers: Endgame, out on April 25.

Read more
Should you read If Beale Street Could Talk first?
Alita: Battle Angel on Time’s Up 4% Challenge
VFX tech invented for Alita: Battle Angel

trail.content:
Rocket Racoon (Credit: Marvel/Disney)

Oreo, the racoon who was the model for Rocket in the Guardians of the Galaxy and Avengers movies, has died following a short illness.

He was 10.

The news was announced by his owners on Facebook.

“We have only the saddest news today,” they wrote. “Our hearts are broken as we have lost our best friend, our Guardian of our Galaxy Mr Oreo Raccoon.

 

“Oreo passed away in the early hours of this morning after a very short illness. Many thanks to our wonderful vets for their compassion and care.

“Oreo you made so many people’s lives happy. You have been an amazing ambassador for raccoons everywhere.”

Oreo was used in motion capture during the making of the movies, to accurately convey real racoon movements and mannerisms, and famously accompanied director James Gunn down the red carpet at the first movie’s premiere in London in 2014.

(Credit: AFP)

“You loved all people of all ages and other animals too and were never phased by anything be it a walk down the red carpet as Rocket Raccoon, a trip to a hospice to visit a sick child or anything else that came your way. You just enjoyed everything and it showed,” the statement went on.

You instinctively knew when to calm, when to be bouncy and we never worried that you would do the wrong thing because you never did.

You were perfect.

“Have fun up there over the Rainbow Bridge my darling. I hope, no I know they will all love you as much as we do. We will miss you so, so much. Fly high Oreo, our super hero.”

Rocket Racoon is voiced by Bradley Cooper in the Guardians of the Galaxy and Avengers movies.

He’ll next be seen in Avengers: Endgame, out on April 25.

tags: @colleen pls don't hurt me for this
summary: ~ endgame spoilers ~ so i have a theory,,,,but before we get into the juice, i just want to say this is purely speculation based...
body:
~ endgame spoilers ~

so i have a theory,,,,but before we get into the juice, i just want to say this is purely speculation based on things i’ve observed from the trailers, leaked bts photos and promotional art, that involves clint but i’ve gathered from what we’ve seen of natasha. 

now, endgame is three hours long right? that’s a lot of time, a lot of time and i think, somewhere in the middle of that, clint’s going to be killed off.

let’s start with the timeline, according to natasha’s hair:

1. immediately post-infinity war
2. some time has passed, probably around 5-7 months??
3. an even bigger time jump, about a year and half, maybe.

i’m guessing a relatively big chunk of the movie happens in timeline #2, since she has that same hair in the promo where she sees clint as ronin for the first time:

look, we know nothing about this movie, so i’m going along with what marvel has given us so far. even if they cgi’d her hair colour in timeline #2 (and i believe they did because the tone is off), it’s the length i’m looking at here. 

but something’s been….bothering me about this scene:

since months have passed, and we do get scenes before that (the scene on the field, her scenes with steve on the quinjet etc.),,, is that just a delayed reaction?? or did something happen then to trigger is response? this isn’t like a Natasha we’ve seen before, regardless of what situations she’s been in. she’s trying very hard to contain her emotions here, masking it with rage, by channeling it into what she knows best (fighting, perfecting her skills). but she’s not doing a very good job, you can tell there’s significant pain behind her actions, that something had to set her off at that point.

my assumption? that this is her reaction to clint dying. or at least, part of it. (and that this scene happens a good bit after the scene in Japan)

all of our heroes won’t die in the final battle (which happens in timeline #3), because then those deaths lose significance if it happens around the same time as you know who and who. Clint is an og avenger, so his death will greatly impact the rest of avengers, and i assume that’s going to set the mood/pace for the rest of the movie (similarly to the way the scene in aou did after everyone’s visions)

but that aside, what makes me believe he’s going to be killed off at that point in the movie even more, is in timeline #3 (and only here we’ve seen it), natasha’s wearing the arrow necklace again. we didn’t see it in any of the trailers or footage, but it only showed up in this bts photo (and others from the same diner reshoots):

which is the only time we’ve seen her with this hairstyle and length. which, they’ve also conveniently left out of the trailer and tv spot (but that’s a given, since they would have mostly included earlier scenes, and her hair length would be major spoilers). which, is also the hair she’s been sporting in all of the promotional art and leaked toys/merch so far.

now, this can be nothing, but i just have a strong feeling about it.

3. an even bigger time jump, about a year and half, maybe.

i’m guessing a relatively big chunk of the movie happens in timeline #2, since she has that same hair in the promo where she sees clint as ronin for the first time:

look, we know nothing about this movie, so i’m going along with what marvel has given us so far. even if they cgi’d her hair colour in timeline #2 (and i believe they did because the tone is off), it’s the length i’m looking at here. 

but something’s been….bothering me about this scene:

since months have passed, and we do get scenes before that (the scene on the field, her scenes with steve on the quinjet etc.),,, is that just a delayed reaction?? or did something happen then to trigger is response? this isn’t like a Natasha we’ve seen before, regardless of what situations she’s been in. she’s trying very hard to contain her emotions here, masking it with rage, by channeling it into what she knows best (fighting, perfecting her skills). but she’s not doing a very good job, you can tell there’s significant pain behind her actions, that something had to set her off at that point.

my assumption? that this is her reaction to clint dying. or at least, part of it. (and that this scene happens a good bit after the scene in Japan)

all of our heroes won’t die in the final battle (which happens in timeline #3), because then those deaths lose significance if it happens around the same time as you know who and who. Clint is an og avenger, so his death will greatly impact the rest of avengers, and i assume that’s going to set the mood/pace for the rest of the movie (similarly to the way the scene in aou did after everyone’s visions)

but that aside, what makes me believe he’s going to be killed off at that point in the movie even more, is in timeline #3 (and only here we’ve seen it), natasha’s wearing the arrow necklace again. we didn’t see it in any of the trailers or footage, but it only showed up in this bts photo (and others from the same diner reshoots):

which is the only time we’ve seen her with this hairstyle and length. which, they’ve also conveniently left out of the trailer and tv spot (but that’s a given, since they would have mostly included earlier scenes, and her hair length would be major spoilers). which, is also the hair she’s been sporting in all of the promotional art and leaked toys/merch so far.

now, this can be nothing, but i just have a strong feeling about it.
trail.content:
~ endgame spoilers ~

so i have a theory,,,,but before we get into the juice, i just want to say this is purely speculation based on things i’ve observed from the trailers, leaked bts photos and promotional art, that involves clint but i’ve gathered from what we’ve seen of natasha. 

now, endgame is three hours long right? that’s a lot of time, a lot of time and i think, somewhere in the middle of that, clint’s going to be killed off.

let’s start with the timeline, according to natasha’s hair:

1. immediately post-infinity war
2. some time has passed, probably around 5-7 months??
3. an even bigger time jump, about a year and half, maybe.

i’m guessing a relatively big chunk of the movie happens in timeline #2, since she has that same hair in the promo where she sees clint as ronin for the first time:

look, we know nothing about this movie, so i’m going along with what marvel has given us so far. even if they cgi’d her hair colour in timeline #2 (and i believe they did because the tone is off), it’s the length i’m looking at here. 

but something’s been….bothering me about this scene:

since months have passed, and we do get scenes before that (the scene on the field, her scenes with steve on the quinjet etc.),,, is that just a delayed reaction?? or did something happen then to trigger is response? this isn’t like a Natasha we’ve seen before, regardless of what situations she’s been in. she’s trying very hard to contain her emotions here, masking it with rage, by channeling it into what she knows best (fighting, perfecting her skills). but she’s not doing a very good job, you can tell there’s significant pain behind her actions, that something had to set her off at that point.

my assumption? that this is her reaction to clint dying. or at least, part of it. (and that this scene happens a good bit after the scene in Japan)

all of our heroes won’t die in the final battle (which happens in timeline #3), because then those deaths lose significance if it happens around the same time as you know who and who. Clint is an og avenger, so his death will greatly impact the rest of avengers, and i assume that’s going to set the mood/pace for the rest of the movie (similarly to the way the scene in aou did after everyone’s visions)

but that aside, what makes me believe he’s going to be killed off at that point in the movie even more, is in timeline #3 (and only here we’ve seen it), natasha’s wearing the arrow necklace again. we didn’t see it in any of the trailers or footage, but it only showed up in this bts photo (and others from the same diner reshoots):

which is the only time we’ve seen her with this hairstyle and length. which, they’ve also conveniently left out of the trailer and tv spot (but that’s a given, since they would have mostly included earlier scenes, and her hair length would be major spoilers). which, is also the hair she’s been sporting in all of the promotional art and leaked toys/merch so far.

now, this can be nothing, but i just have a strong feeling about it.

summary: The Official Synopsis For Avengers: Endgame Released
title: The Official Synopsis For Avengers: Endgame Released
body:
The Official Synopsis For Avengers: Endgame Released

Credit: Marvel Studios

Avengers: Endgame will officially be released this year. We can’t wait to see on the big screen, if only for the sake of our emotional devastation.

While we’re sure Endgame will bring a fresh wave of tears, we need the closure. We’re ready for it. It’s been over a decade. It’s time.

Today, the first synopsis for Avengers: Endgame was released, courtesy of Disney’s…

summary: Disney Unveils New Synopsis for Avengers: Endgame
title: Disney Unveils New Synopsis for Avengers: Endgame
body:
Disney Unveils New Synopsis for Avengers: Endgame

Disney unveiled a new plot synopsis for Avengers: Endgame on their Australian website.

It reads:

“After the devastating events of Avengers: Infinity War (2018), the universe is in ruins due to the efforts of the Mad Titan, Thanos. With the help of remaining allies, the Avengers must assemble once more in order to undo Thanos’ actions and restore order to the universe once and for all, no matter…

title: Svelata la nuova trama ufficiale di Avengers: Endgame
body:
Svelata la nuova trama ufficiale di Avengers: Endgame

Dopo aver apprezzato l’intenso spot tv “by Super Bowl” di Avengers: Endgame, i Marvel Studios hanno svelato la nuova sinossi ufficiale.

Ad aggiornare le informazioni sulla trama di quello che si prospetta come il film più atteso del 2019, è stato Disney Australia attraverso un breve comunicato.
